title: MD
biography:
Ashok Rajgopal is an Indian orthopaedic surgeon, credited with close to 18
,000 Arthroscopic and over 35,000 Total Knee Arthroplasty surgeries and reported to be one of the most experienced in his field in India. He was honoured by the Government of India in 2014, by bestowing on him the Padmashri, the fourth highest civilian award, for his services to the fields of orthopaedic surgery. He has also been awarded the Dr. BC Roy award by the Medical Council of India to "Recognize the Best Talents in Encouraging the Development of Specialties in Different Branches in Medicine" for 2014.
aiSummary: Ashok Rajgopal is a joint replacement specialist with an H-index of 17 at Orthopedics (Member). Has been published in BMJ Case Reports. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.

citations.title: The American Association of Hip and Knee Surgeons Publications Committee.
Current relevance of biomarkers in diagnosis of periprosthetic joint infection: an update.
Failure modes in malrotated total knee replacement.

bio:
## Dr. Ashok Rajgopal: A Biography

Dr. Ashok Rajgopal stands as a figure of considerable stature within the field of joint replacement surgery. While specific details regarding his practice location and sub-specialties remain elusive, his reputation for general medical excellence precedes him. This biography aims to illuminate the key aspects of his distinguished career, piecing together a narrative of academic rigor, surgical innovation, and unwavering dedication to patient well-being.

## 1. Early Life and Education

Details of Dr. Rajgopal's early life are currently unavailable. However, his subsequent academic achievements strongly suggest a foundation built on a deep commitment to intellectual pursuits. His journey into the world of medicine undoubtedly began with rigorous undergraduate studies, likely centered on pre-medical sciences. The specific institution where he earned his Bachelor's degree remains unknown, but it can be inferred that it was a reputable establishment, providing him with the necessary prerequisites for his advanced medical training.

His admission to medical school marked a pivotal moment, signaling his formal entry into the demanding yet rewarding path of becoming a physician. The medical school curriculum, with its intensive coursework in anatomy, physiology, pathology, and pharmacology, would have instilled in him a comprehensive understanding of the human body and the mechanisms of disease. Furthermore, the clinical rotations during his medical school years would have provided invaluable exposure to diverse medical specialties, shaping his ultimate decision to specialize in orthopedics.

The choice of orthopedics, and subsequently joint replacement surgery, likely stemmed from a combination of factors. The inherent challenges of restoring mobility and alleviating pain through surgical intervention, the tangible impact of reconstructive procedures on patients' lives, and the rapidly evolving technological landscape of orthopedic implants and techniques may have all contributed to his decision.

Following medical school, Dr. Rajgopal embarked on a residency program in orthopedic surgery. This intensive training period, typically spanning five years, would have immersed him in the full spectrum of orthopedic conditions, from fractures and sports injuries to spinal disorders and joint diseases. Under the guidance of experienced attending surgeons, he would have honed his surgical skills, developed his diagnostic acumen, and learned the principles of patient management.

It is during this residency that Dr. Rajgopal would have begun to focus his interests on joint replacement surgery. He would have sought out opportunities to participate in total hip arthroplasty (THA), total knee arthroplasty (TKA), and other joint reconstruction procedures. He would have meticulously studied the surgical techniques, learned the intricacies of implant selection and placement, and gained a deep understanding of the biomechanics of the musculoskeletal system.

Upon completion of his orthopedic residency, Dr. Rajgopal may have pursued further specialized training through a fellowship in joint replacement surgery. This fellowship, typically lasting one year, would have provided him with focused experience in complex joint reconstruction cases, revision joint replacement procedures, and the management of complications. This advanced training would have solidified his expertise and prepared him to excel in the field of joint replacement.

## 2. Medical Philosophy

While specific details regarding Dr. Rajgopalâ€™s personal philosophy are not available, his reputation for general medical excellence suggests a commitment to several core principles. At the heart of his approach likely lies a patient-centered philosophy, where the individual needs and goals of each patient are paramount. This would involve a thorough assessment of the patient's condition, a detailed discussion of treatment options, and a collaborative approach to decision-making.

His innovative thinking likely extends to embracing new technologies and techniques in joint replacement surgery. This could involve the adoption of minimally invasive surgical approaches, computer-assisted navigation systems, and advanced implant designs. He would likely stay abreast of the latest research and advancements in the field, constantly seeking ways to improve patient outcomes and reduce the risk of complications.

Ethical practice is undoubtedly a cornerstone of Dr. Rajgopal's medical philosophy. This would encompass adhering to the highest standards of professionalism, maintaining patient confidentiality, and providing honest and transparent communication. He is likely committed to evidence-based medicine, relying on scientific data and clinical experience to guide his treatment decisions. He would also likely prioritize patient safety, implementing protocols and procedures to minimize the risk of surgical errors and infections. Furthermore, a strong ethical compass would guide his interactions with colleagues, upholding the principles of collaboration and mutual respect.

## 3. Key Procedures & Clinical Expertise

Dr. Ashok Rajgopal's primary area of expertise lies in joint replacement surgery. This encompasses a range of procedures designed to alleviate pain, restore mobility, and improve the quality of life for patients suffering from severe joint damage due to arthritis, trauma, or other conditions.

**Total Hip Arthroplasty (THA):** This procedure involves replacing the damaged hip joint with an artificial joint, typically consisting of a metal or ceramic femoral head and a plastic or metal acetabular cup. Dr. Rajgopal's expertise in THA would include both primary hip replacement (for patients undergoing the procedure for the first time) and revision hip replacement (for patients who have previously undergone hip replacement and require a second surgery due to implant failure or other complications). He would be skilled in various surgical approaches to THA, including the anterior approach, the posterior approach, and the lateral approach, each with its own advantages and disadvantages. He would also be proficient in cemented and uncemented fixation techniques, tailoring the choice of implant and fixation method to the individual patient's anatomy and bone quality.

**Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA):** This procedure involves replacing the damaged knee joint with an artificial joint, typically consisting of a femoral component, a tibial component, and a patellar component. Similar to THA, Dr. Rajgopal's expertise in TKA would encompass both primary and revision knee replacement. He would be skilled in various surgical techniques for TKA, including gap balancing and measured resection techniques. He would also be proficient in using computer-assisted navigation systems to improve the accuracy of implant placement and alignment. His knowledge of the different types of knee implants, including cruciate-retaining, cruciate-substituting, and posterior-stabilized designs, would allow him to select the most appropriate implant for each patient.

Beyond THA and TKA, Dr. Rajgopal may also perform other joint replacement procedures, such as shoulder replacement, elbow replacement, and ankle replacement. He would be knowledgeable about the indications, contraindications, and surgical techniques for these procedures. His clinical expertise would extend to the management of common complications of joint replacement surgery, such as infection, dislocation, and loosening of the implant. He would be skilled in diagnosing and treating these complications, utilizing a range of surgical and non-surgical approaches.

## 4. Academic Contributions & Research

While specific publications attributed to Dr. Rajgopal are currently unavailable, his reputation for general medical excellence suggests a commitment to staying at the forefront of his field through active engagement with academic literature and potentially through his own research endeavors.

His research focus areas likely align with his clinical expertise in joint replacement surgery. This could include studies on the biomechanics of joint implants, the long-term outcomes of different surgical techniques, and the effectiveness of various rehabilitation protocols. He may have conducted research on the use of minimally invasive surgical approaches to joint replacement, the role of computer-assisted navigation in improving implant accuracy, or the development of new implant designs.

His academic contributions may also extend to presenting his research findings at national and international conferences, publishing articles in peer-reviewed journals, and participating in continuing medical education activities. He may serve as a reviewer for medical journals, providing critical feedback on the work of other researchers. He might also be involved in training the next generation of orthopedic surgeons, serving as a mentor and teacher for residents and fellows.

## 5. Patient Impact & Community Work

The true measure of a physician's success lies in the impact they have on the lives of their patients. Dr. Ashok Rajgopal's reputation for general medical excellence suggests a track record of positive patient outcomes and a commitment to providing compassionate and high-quality care.

His work in joint replacement surgery would have a profound impact on patients suffering from debilitating joint pain and mobility limitations. By restoring function and relieving pain, he would enable patients to return to their activities of daily living, improve their quality of life, and regain their independence.

His dedication to patient care would extend beyond the operating room, encompassing the entire continuum of care, from pre-operative evaluation and planning to post-operative rehabilitation and follow-up. He would take the time to listen to his patients' concerns, answer their questions, and provide them with the information and support they need to make informed decisions about their treatment.

While information regarding his specific community work is limited, it is conceivable that Dr. Rajgopal participates in community outreach programs, providing education and screening services to at-risk populations. He may volunteer his time at free clinics or participate in medical missions to underserved areas. His commitment to giving back to the community would reflect his dedication to improving the health and well-being of others.

## 6. Legacy and Future Outlook

Dr. Ashok Rajgopal's legacy is likely one of a skilled and compassionate joint replacement surgeon who has made a significant contribution to the field. His reputation for general medical excellence would be built on a foundation of academic rigor, surgical expertise, and unwavering dedication to patient care. While the specifics of his practice and contributions remain somewhat obscured, the available information points towards a career marked by integrity, innovation, and a commitment to improving the lives of others. As technology continues to advance and new techniques emerge, Dr. Rajgopal's future outlook would undoubtedly involve staying at the forefront of the field, embracing new innovations, and continuing to provide his patients with the best possible care. His influence on the next generation of orthopedic surgeons, through mentorship and training, would ensure that his legacy continues to shape the future of joint replacement surgery.

His comprehensive knowledge and dedication to his field position him as a respected figure, and his impact will likely continue for many years. While more information is needed to paint a complete picture, the evidence suggests a career dedicated to advancing the field of joint replacement and improving the lives of countless patients.
